results.justification: The document states: "In this study, we detailed a case study with 30 online and distance learning undergraduate students..." and describes the overall approach.
Sections 3.1 (Sample), 3.2 (Methods of data collection), and 3.3 (Methods of data analysis) provide a step-by-step description of the study design.
The document does not mention the availability of raw or processed datasets.
No justification is provided for the lack of data sharing, as no sharing is mentioned.
There is no mention of a data dictionary or codebook.
Section 3.2 details the data collection methods (survey and interviews).
The document does not mention the availability of analysis code.
No justification is provided for the lack of code sharing, as no sharing is mentioned.
The document does not mention code for data preparation.
The document states: "Both descriptive and inferential statistics (Spearman’s r) were used to address RQ2."
Spearman’s rho correlation coefficients, p-values are reported (e.g., "rs(19) = .468, p = .032").
The document provides subjective context and interpretation of interview and survey data throughout sections 4.1 and 4.3.
The document describes thematic analysis and mentions inter-rater reliability exercise to ensure coding consistency.
Results are presented in sections 4.1 (Survey analysis) and 4.3 (Interview analysis) with descriptive statistics and thematic analysis.
The document discusses limitations, such as the small sample size and potential biases related to the student sample (e.g., demographics).
The document does not contain a link to a preregistration.
